author: Antoine Comte
title: EN IMAGES. Apr\u00e8s la temp\u00eate, les aurores bor\u00e9ales dans le ciel de Franche-Comt\u00e9 : retrouvez les plus beaux cli
text: Dans la nuit du 10 au 11 octobre 2024, des sublimes aurores boréales ont illuminé notre ciel. Comme toute la planète, la Franche-Comté a aussi vu ce phénomène lumineux rare égayer ses heures nocturnes. Retrouver les plus belles photos. Du rose, bleu, vert, violet dans le ciel étoilé. Dans la nuit du 10 au 11 octobre 2024, les Français ont été nombreux à voir de magnifiques aurores boréales se dessiner au-dessus de leur tête. [Déjà aperçu en mai dernier en Franche-Comté](/bourgogne-franche-comte/doubs/besancon/en-images-une-nuit-historique-les-aurores-boreales-ont-illumine-le-ciel-de-franche-comte-decouvrez-les-plus-belles-photos-2968001.html), ce phénomène climatique rare a cette fois-ci concernée toute la planète. De l'Amérique du Nord à l'Océanie en passant par l'Europe, de nombreux internautes ont ainsi partagé leurs plus beaux clichés. La Franche-Comté ne fait pas exception à la règle. Sur sa page Facebook Météo Franc-comtoise, Ilyes Ghouil, météorologue indépendant, avait alerté dès 18 h 45 sur l'apparition des aurores, dues à une tempête géomagnétique majeure. Et si les conditions météo de la soirée (nuages et pluies) ont compliqué les prises de vues, de nombreux Francs-Comtois ont partagé leurs plus belles photos sur les réseaux sociaux dans le Doubs, dans le Jura, en Haute-Saône et dans le Territoire de Belfort. Florilège. Oyrières (70) Clerval (25) Passonfontaine (25) Le Russey (25) C'est dans la nuit que la plupart des Francs-comtois ont réussi à prendre les photos de ces aurores boréales... alors qu'elles sont apparues dans notre ciel grâce à l'activité du soleil. En effet, la tempête magnétique à laquelle on doit cette apparition résulte d'une éruption solaire. "Ces éruptions solaires se répètent environ tous les 11 ans" expliquait Ilyes Ghouil, créateur du site Météo franc-comtoise, en mai dernier. "Le soleil est aussi un organisme cyclique. Là, on a eu plusieurs éruptions solaires, qui ont dégagé beaucoup de gaz chaud en direction de la Terre" Un pic solaire bientôt proche Comprenez par là que le Soleil est presque à son pic d'activité dans un cycle de onze années. Il multiplie donc les déjections de gaz, qui créent les aurores boréales. "Ces déjections de gaz ont heurté le champ magnétique terrestre au niveau des pôles" continuait Ilyes Ghouil. "Cela a créé une tempête magnétique". Pour rappel, les derniers phénomènes de ce genre ont eu lieu en 1987, 2005, et 2024. Un phénomène météorologique qui a pu apporter un peu de bonheur et de gaieté dans le ciel franc-comtois. En effet, la veille, dans la nuit du 9 au 10 octobre, la région avait été frappée par des vents violents et de fortes pluies, dont les conséquences se font toujours ressentir. À l'heure où nous écrivons ces lignes, 2 800 foyers comtois sont toujours privés d'électricité à cause de la tempête Kirk.

author: lesoir.com
title: CAN 2024: tenant du titre, le Sénégal bat le Cameroun et accède aux 8e de finale - Le Soir
text:
Quatre jours après avoir battu la Gambie de Tom Saintfiet, le Sénégal s’est de nouveau imposé vendredi soir contre le Cameroun 3-1. AFP Par la rédaction Publié le 19/01/2024 à 20:53 Temps de lecture: 1 min Q uatre jours après avoir battu la Gambie de Tom Saintfiet, le Sénégal s’est de nouveau imposé vendredi soir contre le Cameroun (3-1), lors de la Coupe d’Afrique des Nations en Côte d’Ivoire. L’équipe tenante du titre est la deuxième à se qualifier pour les huitièmes de finale après le Cap-Vert, vainqueur du Mozambique dans l’après-midi.
Le Marseillais Ismaïla Sarr a ouvert le score (16e). À la suite d’un corner, le ballon lui est revenu dans les pieds et le Sénégalais a marqué en se retournant, profitant d’une déviation de Frank Zambo-Anguissa. Les Lions de la Téranga ont fait le break en deuxième période grâce à Habib Diallo (71e), sur un centre de Sarr, mais Jean-Charles Castelletto a réduit la marque pour le Cameroun à la suite d’un corner (83e). Sadio Mané a finalement soulagé ses coéquipiers d’une reprise en finesse du pied droit (90e+3).
Au classement du groupe C, le Sénégal est seul en tête avec six points. Derrière, la Guinée (2e) et le Cameroun comptent un point. Les hommes de Saintfiet sont derniers, sans point marqué, mais jouent la Guinée à 21h.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 科创100指数ETF（588030）跌0.31%，半日成交额1.24亿元|ETF_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，科创100指数ETF（588030）跌0.31%，报0.973元，成交额1.24亿元。科创100指数ETF（588030）重仓股方面， 恒玄科技 截止午盘涨2.03%， 百济神州 跌1.21%， 睿创微纳 涨2.09%， 翱捷科技 涨1.60%， 泽璟制药 跌0.57%， 绿的谐波 涨1.26%， 国盾量子 跌2.75%， 乐鑫科技 涨1.97%， 铂力特 跌0.27%， 芯源微 涨1.32%。
科创100指数ETF（588030）业绩比较基准为 上证科创板100指数 收益率，管理人为博时基金管理有限公司，基金经理为唐屹兵，成立（2023-09-06）以来回报为-2.49%，近一个月回报为1.93%。

author: myfox28columbus.com
title: Columbus residents brave the cold temps
text: {p}It’s that time of year again, time to shake the dust off winter gear.{/p}{p}Wednesday night into Thursday morning, many woke up to bone-chilling weather this morning.{/p}{p}“Not my time to shine. My time to endure and enjoy, though,” said shopper Lorrie Dean.{/p}{p}Despite the cold temperatures, Lorrie Dean bundled up from head to toe out doing some shopping.{/p}{p}{sd-embed A few light snow showers Thursday night, then slowly warming up heading into the weekend, with rain returning by Sunday.{/p}{p}“It’s cold, so I got my mittens. I like the cold as long as the sun is out to soften it,” said Dean.{/p}{p}If you were to travel to Goodale Park, you would see ice forming at the pond.{/p}{p}Some people are eager for colder weather.{/p}{p}“I personally like the cold; this is my season. I think I feel great,” said resident Megan Holland.{/p}{p}Winter doesn’t officially start until next Saturday.

author: The Daily Beast
title: Hunter’s Women: The Three Exes Tangled Up in Biden’s Trial
text:
One is a church-going non-profit executive. One is a dancer at a strip club. One was a school counselor married to Hunter Biden ’s brother, Beau. But what do they all have in common? They’re the three former romantic partners of Hunter and could be the key to making him the first son of a president to ever be convicted of criminal charges.
All three testified for the prosecution this week in Delaware federal court, where Biden is facing three charges in connection with an October 2018 federal firearms application. The women could not be more different, but each provided an intimate testimony of their relationships with Biden and his self-destructive behavior around his escalating drug use over the last decade.
The gut-wrenching testimonies have taken up at least two days of the trial as the prosecution seeks to prove that Biden knowingly lied when he wrote he was not taking drugs when he bought the firearm. Critics, however, believe the airing of Biden’s love life and drug habits in open court is just meant to humiliate the president’s son for a criminal charge that is rarely prosecuted.
Former federal prosecutor Neama Rahmani told The Daily Beast that while the three women are very different, “they were all consistent in describing Hunter’s crack cocaine use” and that may be too much for the defense to overcome.
“[The defense are] arguing that Hunter didn’t think he was a user or addict when he bought the gun, so they’ve opened the door to all the embarrassing evidence coming in: the laptop images with drug paraphernalia, messages to and about drug dealers, and testimony from his exes,” he added.
Here are the three women at the center of the prosecution’s case:
Kathleen Buhle Buhle, a non-profit executive and writer, met Biden in July 1992 while the two were working as volunteers at a Portland church. Three months after the couple started dating, Buhle fell pregnant and they married about a year later. The pair, who moved to Wilmington before settling down in D.C., had two more daughters together.
In her 2022 memoir, If We Break , Buhle details her 24-year relationship with Biden and his struggle with addiction. She wrote that she first noticed his drinking problem in 2001, after the birth of their second child as he began a new job as a partner at a D.C. lobbying firm.
“I watched his drinking spiral from social to problematic,” she wrote. “Watching how much he could consume scared me…For the first time, I didn’t trust my husband.”
Biden would ultimately go to rehab three times during their marriage but continued to struggle with sobriety and would often lash out at Buhle whenever she was suspicious he relapsed. She wrote that one dark period for Biden came after his brother Beau was diagnosed with a fatal form of brain cancer, which led to Hunter openly leaving bottles of vodka and cans of beer throughout their home.
It wasn’t until July 2015, however, that she got confirmation of her long-held suspicion that Biden was also doing drugs. On the stand Wednesday, Buhle told jurors that Biden admitted to smoking crack after she found a crack pipe in an ashtray on the porch of their D.C. home. She moved out, but it wasn’t until she discovered his infidelity that she started the process of separation.
Buhle wrote in her memoir that Biden admitted to cheating on her at least five times during their marriage, including with his late brother’s wife, Hallie. She wrote that while she initially tried to work on their marriage, it was Biden who began to pull away as he started to spend more time with Hallie and her children—before Hallie eventually stopped responding to her.
Ultimately, she wrote in the book, she learned the full extent of Biden’s relationship with Hallie through her daughter.
“Hunter’s relapses, Beau’s diagnosis, the cheating—each of these moments had brought a powerful, visceral wave of emotion,” she wrote. “But this news, in some ways the very most damning, seemed to sit placidly on the surface…I felt a strange sense of vindication. Not only had I not been crazy, but it was so much worse than I could have imagined.”
She filed for divorce in 2016, which was finalized a year later . On top of dealing with the loss of her long-term relationship, Buhle wrote she also learned she had stage 3 colon cancer in 2019—the same year she removed Biden as her last name. In 2022, she announced she was cancer-free.
Zoe Kestan About seven months after Biden and Buhle’s divorce was finalized, the president’s son went to a Manhattan gentlemen’s club for a night out—and met dancer Zoe Kestan.
Kestan, a lingerie designer who has worked for many New York artists and textile designers over the last decade, told jurors she was 24 when she met Biden. The president’s son was double her age at 48.
It was a night in late December 2017 when Kestan was asked to do one last 30-minute private dance. When she arrived, she said a “charming” Biden was already in the room with another dancer.
Biden then started playing a Fleet Foxes song as they began talking before he went to the room’s balcony to smoke out of a pipe. “I remember thinking to myself [that] I didn’t notice a change in his behavior,” Kestan testified. “Nothing had changed, he was the same charming person.”
The rest of the meeting was uneventful, ending with Biden asking her if she wanted to go back to his hotel and her passing along her number when she declined.
About a week later, after she realized she had met Joe Biden’s son, she met up with him at the Soho Grand Hotel. She testified that Biden was playing “loud rock music” when she entered and he began smoking minutes after her arrival.
Kestan said that while she declined his invitation to join him, the hotel room hangout led to a 10-month whirlwind romance during which Biden would often call her his “distraction” to crack. At one point, she said, Biden was smoking crack “every 20 minutes or so” throughout the week and she saw him buy drugs on multiple occasions.
The pair ended their relationship in October 2018, around the time prosecutors allege he lied on his gun form.
Hallie Biden The start of Hallie Biden and her brother-in-law’s romantic relationship is hard to pinpoint, but both have claimed it started amid their immense shared grief over Beau’s death.
The two, who have known each other since middle school, have both claimed it started in 2017 and lasted until 2019—but that it ultimately “didn’t work” amid public scrutiny. Behind the scenes, Hallie revealed in court Thursday, the pair also struggled with Biden’s addiction, his attempts at sobriety, and eventually, her own struggle with drugs.
“I think people were confused by it,” Hunter Biden said of the relationship in a 2021 CBS Sunday Morning interview. “And I understand that. I mean, I really do. To me, it’s not something that is difficult to explain. Because it came out of a real overwhelming grief that we both shared. And we were together, and trying to do the right thing. And that grief turned into a hope for a love that maybe could replace what we lost.”
Hallie Biden, a former school counselor and non-profit executive, said in court Thursday that she didn’t initially know about Biden’s crack usage until she found the drug in her Wilmington home after they started dating.
“I didn’t know what it was,” she said, adding that she had to “Google it” before confronting him.
Soon, she said, she started accompanying Biden to buy drugs—and eventually started using crack cocaine after visiting him in Los Angeles in the summer of 2018.
“It was a terrible experience that I went through, and I’m embarrassed and I’m ashamed of that period of my life,” she told jurors on Thursday.
Months later, she found the gun Biden had purchased in 2018 in his truck and quickly discarded it behind a grocery store. Hallie testified on Thursday that the incident turned their relationship “more tense” when Biden told her she’d have to file a police report because the gun was registered in his name.
In text messages revealed in court, Biden yelled at Hallie for invading his privacy. Days later, she texted him to not return to their shared home.
“Don’t come back to the house, obviously you have something in New York more important to you than me,” she wrote in what appears to be a reference to Kestan.
The two broke up months later. On the stand, she admitted that Biden would often lie to her during their relationship.
The post Hunter’s Women: The Three Exes Tangled Up in Biden’s Trial appeared first on The Daily Beast .

author: BL Mangaluru Bureau
title: Crude oil set to rise for fourth week in a row - The Hindu BusinessLine
text:
Crude oil prices were set for a fourth week of gains due to increased demand during summer in the US, and concerns over possible supply disruptions due to geopolitical factors. However, crude oil futures traded lower on Friday morning.
At 9.52 am on Friday, September Brent oil futures were at $87.17, down by 0.30 per cent, and August crude oil futures on WTI (West Texas Intermediate) were at $83.74, down by 0.38 per cent.
July crude oil futures were trading at ₹6,989 on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) during initial trading on Friday morning, against the previous close of ₹7,024, down by 0.50 per cent, and August futures were trading at ₹6,930, against the previous close of ₹6,964, down by 0.49 per cent.
There was thin trading and no settlement in WTI following the holiday in the US on Thursday.
Rise in US summer travel Crude oil prices were trading above 3 per cent for the week. One of the reasons for this was the increase in summer travel in the US.
Recently, the American Automobile Association had said that US holiday travel is expected to grow by 5.2 per cent during this summer season. The association had forecast that car travel alone will grow by 4.8 per cent in this travel season.
Added to this, recent data by the US EIA (Energy Information Administration) showed a huge decrease in crude oil inventories to the tune of 12.2 million barrels for the week ending June 28. Total motor gasoline inventories also declined 2.2 million barrels. The market expects crude oil inventories to decline this week also due to holidays in the US.
Meanwhile, geopolitical tensions in West Asia also supported crude oil prices as the market felt that further escalation in tensions would lead to supply disruptions from the region. Recent reports said Israel had killed of a senior Hezbollah commander. This prompted Hezbollah to retaliate near the border.
Guar gum gains, jeera dips July mentha oil futures were trading at ₹980 on the MCX, against the previous close of ₹968.10, up by 1.23 per cent.
On the National Commodities and Derivatives Exchange (NCDEX), July guar gum contracts were trading at ₹10,467, against the previous close of ₹10,431, up by 0.35 per cent.
August jeera futures were trading at ₹28,525 on NCDEX, against the previous close of ₹28,620, down by 0.33 per cent.

author: Jessica Nix / Bloomberg
title: Gripe aviar ahora ataca a mascotas: Dos gatos mueren en EU y alertan por posible mutación en el virus
text:
Dos gatos domésticos murieron después de contraer
gripe aviar en las casas de trabajadores de una industria lechera, una señal preocupante de que el virus puede estar moviéndose entre especies y volviéndose más común.
Los dueños de los gatos vivían en hogares separados en Michigan y desarrollaron
síntomas de H5N1 en mayo pasado, según un informe publicado el jueves por los Centros para el Control y la Prevención de Enfermedades de Estados Unidos.
Ambos trabajaban en granjas en las que se habían registrado
casos de gripe aviar y presentaron síntomas antes de que los gatos enfermaran, pero se negaron a realizarles pruebas.
Si bien las infecciones humanas han sido poco frecuentes durante
el brote actual de gripe aviar H5N1 (con una sola muerte), más de una docena de estados en Estados Unidos han informado de ganado infectado.
El virus ha causado cientos de muertes en las últimas décadas, y la sugerencia de que haya pasado de las vacas a las personas y a los gatos indica que puede haber adoptado una forma más infecciosa.
¿Qué sabemos de los contagios de gripe aviar en Estados Unidos?
Se sabía que uno de los gatos se revolcaba en la ropa sucia del trabajador, lo que indica que el virus podría haberse propagado de la ropa al gato. Ambos gatos presentaron problemas respiratorios y neurológicos después de la infección, según el informe.
Se ha informado de que los gatos que viven al aire libre han muerto a causa de la
infección por H5N1 tras beber leche cruda o estar expuestos a animales infectados, incluidos el ganado y las aves de corral. El estudio, publicado en el Informe semanal de morbilidad y mortalidad de los CDC, fue el primero en detectar gatos que viven en el interior de la casa con la infección.
El informe se publicó originalmente en el sitio web de los CDC el 5 de febrero, antes de ser eliminado durante la congelación de comunicaciones del Departamento de Salud y Servicios Humanos de Estados Unidos, informó anteriormente el New York Times.
Los esfuerzos de la administración Trump por recortar presupuestos y decretar despidos generalizados en varias agencias de salud han suscitado dudas sobre el intercambio de datos durante el brote y confusión sobre la respuesta del gobierno.
A principios de esta semana, el Departamento de Agricultura de Estados Unidos dijo que los funcionarios que rastreaban la gripe aviar fueron despedidos por error y que están trabajando para reincorporar a los empleados.
Veinticuatro miembros del personal veterinario habían interactuado con los gatos infectados. Siete de ellos informaron síntomas de enfermedad, pero los cinco que aceptaron hacerse la prueba no tenían
el virus de la gripe aviar, según el informe de los CDC.
El riesgo para la salud humana sigue siendo bajo, dijeron los CDC, pero recomiendan que los trabajadores lecheros usen equipo de protección cuando trabajen con animales expuestos.
¿Cuáles son los síntomas de la gripe aviar en humanos?
Aunque los
virus de la influenza aviar por lo general no causan infecciones en humanos, se han reportado casos muy esporádicos de infecciones. En la mayoría, los síntomas transcurren en una enfermedad leve, pero también se han presentado cuadros graves que resultaron en la muerte.
Los signos y síntomas notificados de infecciones por los virus de la influenza aviar en seres humanos pueden incluir:
- Enrojecimiento de los ojos (conjuntivitis)
- Síntomas leves de las vías respiratorias superiores similares a los de la influenza
- Neumonía que requiere hospitalización.
- Fiebre
- Tos
- Dolor de garganta
- Goteo o secreción nasal
- Dolores musculares o corporales
- Dolores de cabeza
- Fatiga
- Dificultad para respirar

author: Heloisa Garret
title: Ingiee uma solução para cálculo e gestão de emissões de gases de efeito estufa
text:
Comandada por tres engenheiras, a Sinergia Engenharia viu na pauta da descarbonização uma oportunidade de negócio, e criou a ingee inovação sustentável, software para cálculo e gestão de emissões de gases de efeito estufa ajudando empresas e organizações para migrar seus negócios para economia de baixo carbono. A convicção de que a sustentabilidade não é apenas uma questão de responsabilidade social, mas também um caminho para a inovação, a eficiência e a competitividade no cenário global, foi o combustível para a criação da Sinergia Engenharia. Fundada em 2014 por três engenheiras ambientais, Jéssica de Miranda Paulo, Juliana de Moraes Ferreira e Maíra Caires Aquino, a empresa nasceu com o compromisso de integrar práticas sustentáveis aos negócios, oferecendo soluções que impulsionam o desenvolvimento sustentável e agregam valor estratégico às organizações.
Para promover a sustentabilidade de forma prática e eficiente, a empresa desenvolveu a Ingee inovação sustentável , uma ferramenta em formato de software que facilita o cálculo e a gestão de emissões de gases de efeito estufa. Permitindo a inserção de dados da instituição inventariante e o cálculo das emissões em tempo real, além de gerar automaticamente o Inventário de Emissões de Gases de Efeito Estufa.
O sistema também oferece uma análise estratégica do desempenho organizacional por meio de um módulo de descarbonização, ajudando as empresas na transição para uma economia de baixo carbono. A metodologia de cálculo segue os padrões do GHG Protocol e IPCC, além das diretrizes da ABNT NBR ISO 14064, garantindo precisão e conformidade com normas internacionais.
Recentemente, a Sinergia Engenharia, por meio da ingee inovação sustentável, realizou o Inventário de Emissões de Gases de Efeito Estufa dos 12 prédios do Banco Central espalhados no Brasil, incluindo Curitiba. “Cada projeto reforça nossa missão de oferecer soluções que não apenas atendam às necessidades das empresas, mas que também as capacitem a tomar decisões mais estratégicas e conscientes. Nosso objetivo é ajudar as organizações a avançarem de forma consistente em sua jornada rumo à neutralidade de carbono, contribuindo para um futuro mais sustentável e alinhado com as exigências do cenário global.”relata Juliana Ferreira, engenheira ambiental e cofundadora da ferramenta.
Da mesma forma que no prédio do Banco Central do Brasil em São Paulo, onde também entregou o certificado, o inventário de Curitiba abrange as emissões associadas a três escopos: emissões diretas, controladas pela organização; emissões indiretas, resultantes da aquisição de energia elétrica consumida pela organização; e outras emissões indiretas, geradas por atividades da organização que ocorrem fora de seu controle direto.
Além dos inventários de GEE dos 12 prédios do Banco Central do Brasil, a Sinergia Engenharia está desenvolvendo projetos semelhantes para o Supremo Tribunal Federal (STF) e o Superior Tribunal de Justiça (STJ), ambos em Brasília, e para a empresa Trensurb, localizada em Porto Alegre, atendendo também diversas outras organizações em todo o Brasil.
O trabalho realizado pela Sinergia Engenharia é fundamental para que as instituições possam mensurar, gerenciar e reduzir seu impacto ambiental. A capacidade de quantificar as emissões possibilita às organizações adotar medidas eficazes na busca pela sustentabilidade.
No ano passado, a empresa conquistou o Selo SESI ODS, que reconhece e divulga práticas inovadoras alinhadas aos Objetivos de Desenvolvimento Sustentável (ODS), contribuindo diretamente para os ODS 9 (Indústria, Inovação e Infraestrutura) e 13 (Ação Contra a Mudança Global do Clima). Desde 2021, a empresa é carbono neutro, é membro do Programa Brasileiro GHG Protocol e foi classificada com nota ‘A’ pelo Governo do Estado do Paraná no programa Selo Clima Paraná. Paralelamente à elaboração dos inventários corporativos, a empresa também oferece cursos sobre o tema, com materiais didáticos e emissão de certificados.
A Sinergia Engenharia é filiada ao LIDE Paraná que semanalmente aborda nesta coluna cases de empresas e empreendedores do Paraná que ganham destaque no Brasil e no mundo.
